   1 import pathlib
   2 import shutil
   3 import subprocess
   4 
   5 import invoke
   6 import parver
   7 
   8 from towncrier._builder import (
   9     find_fragments, render_fragments, split_fragments,
  10 )
  11 from towncrier._settings import load_config
  12 
  13 
  14 ROOT = pathlib.Path(__file__).resolve().parent.parent
  15 
  16 PACKAGE_NAME = 'fake_package'
  17 
  18 INIT_PY = ROOT.joinpath('src', PACKAGE_NAME, '__init__.py')
  19 
  20 
  21 @invoke.task()
  22 def typecheck(ctx):
  23     src_dir = ROOT / "src" / PACKAGE_NAME
  24     src_dir = src_dir.as_posix()
  25     config_file = ROOT / "setup.cfg"
  26     env = {"MYPYPATH": src_dir}
  27     ctx.run(f"mypy {src_dir} --config-file={config_file}", env=env)
  28 
  29 
  30 @invoke.task()
  31 def clean(ctx):
  32     """Clean previously built package artifacts.
  33     """
  34     ctx.run(f'python setup.py clean')
  35     dist = ROOT.joinpath('dist')
  36     print(f'[clean] Removing {dist}')
  37     if dist.exists():
  38         shutil.rmtree(str(dist))
  39 
  40 
  41 def _read_version():
  42     out = subprocess.check_output(['git', 'tag'], encoding='ascii')
  43     try:
  44         version = max(parver.Version.parse(v).normalize() for v in (
  45             line.strip() for line in out.split('\n')
  46         ) if v)
  47     except ValueError:
  48         version = parver.Version.parse('0.0.0')
  49     return version
  50 
  51 
  52 def _write_version(v):
  53     lines = []
  54     with INIT_PY.open() as f:
  55         for line in f:
  56             if line.startswith("__version__ = "):
  57                 line = f"__version__ = {repr(str(v))}\n".replace("'", '"')
  58             lines.append(line)
  59     with INIT_PY.open("w", newline="\n") as f:
  60         f.write("".join(lines))
  61 
  62 
  63 def _render_log():
  64     """Totally tap into Towncrier internals to get an in-memory result.
  65     """
  66     config = load_config(ROOT)
  67     definitions = config["types"]
  68     fragments, fragment_filenames = find_fragments(
  69         pathlib.Path(config["directory"]).absolute(),
  70         config["sections"],
  71         None,
  72         definitions,
  73     )
  74     rendered = render_fragments(
  75         pathlib.Path(config["template"]).read_text(encoding="utf-8"),
  76         config["issue_format"],
  77         split_fragments(fragments, definitions),
  78         definitions,
  79         config["underlines"][1:],
  80         False,  # Don't add newlines to wrapped text.
  81     )
  82     return rendered
  83 
  84 
  85 REL_TYPES = ("major", "minor", "patch", "post")
  86 
  87 
  88 def _bump_release(version, type_):
  89     if type_ not in REL_TYPES:
  90         raise ValueError(f"{type_} not in {REL_TYPES}")
  91     index = REL_TYPES.index(type_)
  92     next_version = version.base_version().bump_release(index=index)
  93     print(f"[bump] {version} -> {next_version}")
  94     return next_version
  95 
  96 
  97 def _prebump(version, prebump):
  98     next_version = version.bump_release(index=prebump).bump_dev()
  99     print(f"[bump] {version} -> {next_version}")
 100     return next_version
 101 
 102 
 103 PREBUMP = 'patch'
 104 
 105 
 106 @invoke.task(pre=[clean])
 107 def release(ctx, type_, repo, prebump=PREBUMP):
 108     """Make a new release.
 109     """
 110     if prebump not in REL_TYPES:
 111         raise ValueError(f'{type_} not in {REL_TYPES}')
 112     prebump = REL_TYPES.index(prebump)
 113 
 114     version = _read_version()
 115     version = _bump_release(version, type_)
 116     _write_version(version)
 117 
 118     # Needs to happen before Towncrier deletes fragment files.
 119     tag_content = _render_log()
 120 
 121     ctx.run('towncrier')
 122 
 123     ctx.run(f'git commit -am "Release {version}"')
 124 
 125     tag_content = tag_content.replace('"', '\\"')
 126     ctx.run(f'git tag -a {version} -m "Version {version}\n\n{tag_content}"')
 127 
 128     ctx.run(f'python setup.py sdist bdist_wheel')
 129 
 130     dist_pattern = f'{PACKAGE_NAME.replace("-", "[-_]")}-*'
 131     artifacts = list(ROOT.joinpath('dist').glob(dist_pattern))
 132     filename_display = '\n'.join(f'  {a}' for a in artifacts)
 133     print(f'[release] Will upload:\n{filename_display}')
 134     try:
 135         input('[release] Release ready. ENTER to upload, CTRL-C to abort: ')
 136     except KeyboardInterrupt:
 137         print('\nAborted!')
 138         return
 139 
 140     arg_display = ' '.join(f'"{n}"' for n in artifacts)
 141     ctx.run(f'twine upload --repository="{repo}" {arg_display}')
 142 
 143     version = _prebump(version, prebump)
 144     _write_version(version)
 145 
 146     ctx.run(f'git commit -am "Prebump to {version}"')
 147 
 148 
 149 @invoke.task
 150 def build_docs(ctx):
 151     _current_version = _read_version()
 152     minor = [str(i) for i in _current_version.release[:2]]
 153     docs_folder = (ROOT / 'docs').as_posix()
 154     if not docs_folder.endswith('/'):
 155         docs_folder = '{0}/'.format(docs_folder)
 156     args = ["--ext-autodoc", "--ext-viewcode", "-o", docs_folder]
 157     args.extend(["-A", "'Dan Ryan <dan@danryan.co>'"])
 158     args.extend(["-R", str(_current_version)])
 159     args.extend(["-V", ".".join(minor)])
 160     args.extend(["-e", "-M", "-F", f"src/{PACKAGE_NAME}"])
 161     print("Building docs...")
 162     ctx.run("sphinx-apidoc {0}".format(" ".join(args)))
 163 
 164 
 165 @invoke.task
 166 def clean_mdchangelog(ctx):
 167     changelog = ROOT / "CHANGELOG.md"
 168     content = changelog.read_text()
 169     content = re.sub(
 170         r"([^\n]+)\n?\s+\[[\\]+(#\d+)\]\(https://github\.com/sarugaku/[\w\-]+/issues/\d+\)",
 171         r"\1 \2",
 172         content,
 173         flags=re.MULTILINE,
 174     )
 175     changelog.write_text(content)
